alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 10:19PM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT/7 AM CDT/ SUNDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and west central Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In west central Kansas, Logan and Wallace. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT Sunday /700 AM CDT Sunday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 PM MDT /1017 PM CDT/, 1 to 2 inches of rain fell over the past several hours. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Additional rainfall is not anticipated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cheyenne Wells, Sharon Springs, Weskan, Bethune, Wallace and Arapahoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
